definitions.definition: A medieval brass instrument chiefly used as a battle signal ; related to the trumpet , it had a narrow , straight pipe and a high-pitched , piercing sound .
examples: The clarion ’s call to action has been heard.

subdefinitions.definition: The sound of a clarion (sense 1) , or any sound resembling the loud , high-pitched note of a clarion.
An organ stop consisting of pipes with reeds giving a high-pitched note like that of a clarion (sense 1) .

definitions.definition: A charge thought to represent a type of wind instrument , a keyboard instrument like a spinet , or perhaps a rest used by a knight to support a lance during jousting .

main_definition: ( music , historical or poetic ) A medieval brass instrument chiefly used as a battle signal ; related to the trumpet , it had a narrow , straight pipe and a high-pitched , piercing sound .
secondary_definitions: ( heraldry ) A charge thought to represent a type of wind instrument , a keyboard instrument like a spinet , or perhaps a rest used by a knight to support a lance during jousting .
